moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6: steering at the closed version, of the Sicilian...
moves.3. d4: the best way to go: contest c5...
moves.3... cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6: I understand this: but this move, does not belong in this system...
moves.6. Be3: maybe a bit early: Ng4 can contest this Bishop...
moves.7... Be7 8. f3: cautious: although f4, was already an option...
moves.10... Qc7 11. g4: the White Kings' wing is on the move...
moves.11... b5 12. g5 Nfd7: weak: b4 might have been an option...
moves.22... Rab8 23. g6 fxg6: not good: this will open up Black Kings' wing...
moves.25... e4: a blunder: Rf6 was life saving...
moves.26. f4: no sweat: but Qh2 was much stronger here...
moves.27... a4: trying to pry open, the White Kings' defense: but White has an evil attack...
moves.29. Qg2: Qh7 or a direct Rxf6+ was also an option: but this works fine...
moves.29... b3: useless: and avoiding the issue at hand...
moves.30. Rxf6+: White has many ways, to win this...
